009
010package imagingbook.common.image;
011
012import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
013
014import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
015import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
016import imagingbook.common.color.colorspace.sRgb65ColorSpace;
017
018/**
019 * This class defines a "color stack" as a subtype of {@link PixelPack} with
020 * exactly 3 components (slices), representing a color image in a specific color
021 * space (default is {@link sRgb65ColorSpace}). It allows simple conversion to
022 * other color spaces (see {@link #convertFromSrgbTo(ColorSpace)}). All
023 * conversions are 'destructive', i.e., the affected color stack is modified.
024 * Pixel values are typically in [0,1], depending on the associated color space.
025 * A {@link ColorPack} may be created from an existing {@link ColorProcessor}
026 * whose pixels are assumed to be in sRGB color space (see
027 * {@link #ColorPack(ColorProcessor)}). To be converted back to a
028 * {@link ColorProcessor}, the {@link ColorPack} must be in sRGB color space
029 * (see {@link #convertToSrgb()}).
030 * 
031 * @author WB
032 * @version 2022/09/10
033 */
034public class ColorPack extends PixelPack {
035        
036        // the current color space of this color stack
037        private ColorSpace colorspace = null;
038        
039        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
040        
041        /**
042         * Constructor.
043         * @param cp a color image assumed to be in sRGB
044         */
045        public ColorPack(ColorProcessor cp) {
046                super(cp, 1.0/255, null);
047                setColorSpace(sRgb65ColorSpace.getInstance());
048        }
049        
050        // -----------------------------------------------------------------
051        
052        /**
053         * Returns the 3 color components as an array of {@link FloatProcessor}.
054         * @return a {@link FloatProcessor} array
055         */
056        public FloatProcessor[] getProcessors() {
057                FloatProcessor[] processors = new FloatProcessor[3];
058                for (int k = 0; k < 3; k++) {
059                        processors[k] = new FloatProcessor(width, height, data[k]);
060                }
061                return processors;
062        }
063        
064        /**
065         * Returns the current color space instance of this {@link ColorPack}.
066         * @return the current color space
067         */
068        public ColorSpace getColorspace() {
069                return this.colorspace;
070        }
071        
072        private void setColorSpace(ColorSpace colorspace) {
073                this.colorspace = colorspace;
074        }
075        
076        // -----------------------------------------------------------------
077        
078        /**
079         * Converts the pixel values of this {@link ColorPack} to the specified
080         * color space. The color stack must be in sRGB space.
081         * Exceptions are thrown if the color stack is not in sRGB color space
082         * or the target color space is sRGB.
083         * 
084         * @param targetColorspace the new color space
085         */
086        public void convertFromSrgbTo(ColorSpace targetColorspace) {
087                if (!(colorspace instanceof sRgb65ColorSpace)) {
088                        throw new IllegalStateException("color stack must be in sRGB");
089                }
090                
091                if (targetColorspace instanceof sRgb65ColorSpace) {
092                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot convert color stack from sRGB to sRGB");
093                }
094                
095                final float[] srgb = new float[3];
096                
097                for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
098                        getPix(i, srgb);
099                        clipTo01(srgb);
100                        float[] c = targetColorspace.fromRGB(srgb);
101                        setPix(i, c);
102                }
103                
104                setColorSpace(targetColorspace);
105        }
106        
107        // -----------------------------------------------------------------
108
109        /**
110         * Converts this {@link ColorPack} to sRGB space.
111         * An exceptions is thrown if the color stack is in sRGB color space
112         * already.
113         */
114        public void convertToSrgb() {
115                if (colorspace instanceof sRgb65ColorSpace) {
116                        throw new IllegalStateException("color stack is in sRGB already");
117                }
118                
119                final float[] c = new float[3];
120                
121                for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
122                        getPix(i, c);
123                        float[] srgb = colorspace.toRGB(c);
124                        setPix(i, srgb);
125                }
126
127                setColorSpace(sRgb65ColorSpace.getInstance());
128        }
129        
130        // ---------------------------------------------------------------
131        
132        @Override
133        public ColorProcessor toColorProcessor() {
134                if (!(colorspace instanceof sRgb65ColorSpace)) {
135                        throw new IllegalStateException("color stack must be in sRGB to convert to ColorProcessor");
136                }
137                return super.toColorProcessor(255);
138        }
139        
140        @Override       // arbitrary scaling is inhibited
141        public ColorProcessor toColorProcessor(double scale) {
142                throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
143        }
144        
145        // ------------------------------------------------------------------
146        
147        private float clipTo01(float val) {
148                if (val < 0) return 0f;
149                if (val > 1) return 1f;
150                return val;
151        }
152        
153        private void clipTo01(float[] vals) {
154                for (int i = 0; i < vals.length; i++) {
155                        vals[i] = clipTo01(vals[i]);
156                }
157        }
158    
159}
